oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DEPTH INVERSION FOR NONLINEAR WAVES SHOALING OVER A BARRED-BEACH
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Grilli, Stephan T.
Skourup, Jesper
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: barred beach
depth inversion
nonlinear waves
shoaling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Characteristics of periodic wave shoaling over a barred-beach are calculated in a fully nonlinear numerical wave tank. Variations of wave elevation, slopes, height, asymmetry, and celerity are discussed. Over and beyond the bar, classical highly nonlinear decomposition phenomena occur in a modulation region (MR); in shallower water, shoaling reoccurs. Depth inversion algorithms developed and calibrated for mild slopes are applied to the barred-beach. Expectedly, errors on depth prediction occur in the MR; suggestions for improvements are made.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
